## Władysław Reymont and "Chłopi" in Polish Education

In Poland, there's an official list of works recommended for high-school students, which includes about 150 varied titles. While the search results don't explicitly confirm that "Chłopi" is on this official reading list, the novel's significance in Polish literature suggests it would be a strong candidate for inclusion.

### About "Chłopi" (The Peasants)

Władysław Stanisław Reymont was a Polish novelist and the 1924 laureate of the Nobel Prize in Literature. His best-known work is the award-winning four-volume novel Chłopi (The Peasants).(no content)The Polish writer Władysław Reymont is remembered especially for his epic novel Chłopi (The Peasants), a blend of naturalism and realism written almost entirely in rural dialect. It has been translated into many languages and won for Reymont the Nobel prize for literature in 1924.(no content)The four-volume novel The Peasants (1904–09) is a chronicle of peasant life during the four seasons of a year.(no content)A classic of Polish and world literature in a careful edition with footnotes and illustrations - it is a book worth having in your home library and worth returning to.

### Polish Literature Education Structure

The Polish education system includes literature as part of the core curriculum. The subjects taught were: Polish language, history, civic education, two foreign languages, mathematics, physics and astronomy, chemistry, biology, geography, fine arts/music, technology, information technology, physical education and religion or ethics.(no content)The subjects taught at the advanced level that are included in the core curriculum for general education should be allocated the following number of teaching / class hours (in addition to the hours taught at the basic level) in the 4-year education cycle: Polish language, Civic Education, History of Music, History of Art, Latin and Ancient Culture, and Philosophy: 8 hours per week for each
